wikipedia_page.main: William Gordon Ridley Loughery (1 November 1907 in Dromore, County Down – 1 August 1977 in Abbey Dore, Herefordshire, England) was an Irish academic and cricketer.  He was a scholar in mathematics at Trinity College Dublin, earning his BA there in 1930. From 1930 to 1934 he taught at Campbell College in Belfast.
